intro: Xanthostemon grandiflorus, commonly known as the large-flowered xanthostemon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellowish to orange flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a rough texture. Xanthostemon grandiflorus is often found in coastal and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments.
